meanings.definition: A rule made by a company or society to control the actions of its members.
meanings.sent1: The bylaws of the club state that all members must attend at least one meeting per month.
meanings.sent2: The company's bylaws outline the procedures for electing new board members.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite chaotic if everyone ignored the bylaws and did whatever they pleased.
meanings.sent4: Following the bylaws is like following a roadmap to success within the organization.
meanings.sent5: The bylaws act as a safety net, ensuring everyone plays by the same rules.

meanings.definition: A rule made by a local government or other organization that controls the way it works.
meanings.sent1: The city council's bylaws regulate the opening hours of businesses in the area.
meanings.sent2: The organization's bylaws require regular audits to maintain transparency.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a world where the bylaws allowed everyone to have a day off every week!
meanings.sent4: The bylaws are the invisible hands guiding the organization's daily operations.
meanings.sent5: Bylaws are like the traffic lights of an organization, ensuring smooth functioning.
